text:
SF Supervisor Joel Engardio will face a recall vote over his support for turning the Great Highway into a park.

text:
Judges aren’t elected, and that’s the point.

They’re supposed to be insulated from politics—so they can check executive power when no one else will.

Strip that power, and we’re not really doing the “checks and balances” thing anymore.

Great piece. We have a tendency to moralize art. Conservatives think that art should be censored because they believe it can be harmful. Liberals think that art is a stand in for actual politics. 

Both are attributing to it a power that it absolutely does not have. I think it's a disservice to art!

text:
"The Democrats are being unfairly criticized."
